feed.title: Awesome Object Capabilities and Capability-based Security
feed.subtitle: Updates to the awesome-ocap list of capability-based security resources

entry.title: genode
entry.summary: is a novel OS architecture that is able to master the complexity of code and policy -- the most fundamental security problem shared by modern general-purpose operating systems -- by applying a strict organizational structure to all software components including device drivers, system services, and applications.
entry.content: is a novel OS architecture that is able to master the complexity of code and policy -- the most fundamental security problem shared by modern general-purpose operating systems -- by applying a strict organizational structure to all software components including device drivers, system services, and applications.

entry.title: Sculpt OS release 25.04
entry.summary: – introduces multi-monitor window management and display rotation, integrates Chromium WebEngine 112, and extends hardware support to Intel Meteor Lake and F&S i.MX8MP armStone boards
entry.content: – introduces multi-monitor window management and display rotation, integrates Chromium WebEngine 112, and extends hardware support to Intel Meteor Lake and F&S i.MX8MP armStone boards

entry.title: Fuchsia
entry.summary: is a real-time operating system in development by Google since Aug 2016. It's based on a microkernel, Zircon, with a capability security model.
entry.content: is a real-time operating system in development by Google since Aug 2016. It's based on a microkernel, Zircon, with a capability security model.

entry.title: Fuchsia F26 release notes
entry.summary: – continues refinement of the component framework, emphasizing explicit capability routing, lifecycle control, and modular isolation between components
entry.content: – continues refinement of the component framework, emphasizing explicit capability routing, lifecycle control, and modular isolation between components

entry.title: Spritely Goblins
entry.summary: - "distributed object programming environment. Goblins provides an intuitive security model, automatic local transactions for locally synchronous operations, and an easy to use and efficient asynchronous programming interface for encapsulated objects which can live anywhere on the network. Its networking model abstracts away these details so the programmer can focus on object programming rather than protocol architecture."
entry.content: - "distributed object programming environment. Goblins provides an intuitive security model, automatic local transactions for locally synchronous operations, and an easy to use and efficient asynchronous programming interface for encapsulated objects which can live anywhere on the network. Its networking model abstracts away these details so the programmer can focus on object programming rather than protocol architecture."

entry.title: Spritely Goblins
entry.summary: - "distributed object programming environment. Goblins provides an intuitive security model, automatic local transactions for locally synchronous operations, and an easy to use and efficient asynchronous programming interface for encapsulated objects which can live anywhere on the network. Its networking model abstracts away these details so the programmer can focus on object programming rather than protocol architecture."
entry.content: - "distributed object programming environment. Goblins provides an intuitive security model, automatic local transactions for locally synchronous operations, and an easy to use and efficient asynchronous programming interface for encapsulated objects which can live anywhere on the network. Its networking model abstracts away these details so the programmer can focus on object programming rather than protocol architecture."

entry.title: Spritely Goblins v0.15.1 Released
entry.summary: "a quality release focused on polish, fixing bugs in CapTP GC, message handling in persistent vats, and netlayer reconnection; also adds a timeout helper and improved race* joiner"
entry.content: "a quality release focused on polish, fixing bugs in CapTP GC, message handling in persistent vats, and netlayer reconnection; also adds a timeout helper and improved race* joiner"

entry.title: Genode OS Framework release 25.02
entry.summary: – extends multi-monitor capabilities to window management and virtual machines, ports QEMU and Chromium WebEngine 112, boosts graphics performance via SIMD optimizations
entry.content: – extends multi-monitor capabilities to window management and virtual machines, ports QEMU and Chromium WebEngine 112, boosts graphics performance via SIMD optimizations

entry.title: Goblins: The framework for your next project!
entry.summary: "Jessica Tallon introduces Goblins, a Guile framework for building secure, fault-tolerant peer-to-peer applications using object capability security and the actor model"
entry.content: "Jessica Tallon introduces Goblins, a Guile framework for building secure, fault-tolerant peer-to-peer applications using object capability security and the actor model"

entry.title: Spritely and a secure, collaborative, distributed future
entry.summary: "Christine Lemmer-Webber outlines Spritely's mission to create decentralized infrastructure that empowers user autonomy and security"
entry.content: "Christine Lemmer-Webber outlines Spritely's mission to create decentralized infrastructure that empowers user autonomy and security"

entry.title: Spritely Goblins v0.15.0: Goblins in the Browser
entry.summary: "Goblins code can now be compiled to WebAssembly and run in the browser, with a WebSocket netlayer and goblin-chat demo; includes major performance boosts"
entry.content: "Goblins code can now be compiled to WebAssembly and run in the browser, with a WebSocket netlayer and goblin-chat demo; includes major performance boosts"

entry.title: Fuchsia F24 release notes
entry.summary: – introduces improvements in diagnostics scoping and structured logging, reinforcing least-authority principles in observability tooling
entry.content: – introduces improvements in diagnostics scoping and structured logging, reinforcing least-authority principles in observability tooling

entry.title: Tahoe-LAFS
entry.summary:
is a highly available decentralized cloud storage system. Even if some of the servers fail or are taken over by an attacker, the entire file store continues to function correctly, preserving your privacy and security.
  • 2024-12: [v1.20.0 is released]https://lists.tahoe-lafs.org/pipermail/tahoe-dev/2024-December/010111.html)
  • 2024-01-01 v1.19.0 released
  • 2023-11: new work on a Haskell client implementation
  • 2020-02: Tahoe-LAFS Summit at PyCon2020
entry.content:
is a highly available decentralized cloud storage system. Even if some of the servers fail or are taken over by an attacker, the entire file store continues to function correctly, preserving your privacy and security.
  • 2024-12: [v1.20.0 is released]https://lists.tahoe-lafs.org/pipermail/tahoe-dev/2024-December/010111.html)

entry.title: Spritely Goblins v0.14.0: libp2p and Improved Persistence
entry.summary: "introduces a libp2p netlayer, cross-vat persistence using ^persistence-registry, self-referential actors with #:self, and actor upgrade macros"

entry.title: Cloudflare Workers
entry.summary:
• 2024-04: We’ve added JavaScript-native RPC to Cloudflare Workers – Kenton Varda introduces a secure, ergonomic RPC mechanism built into the Workers platform, enabling structured, streamed, bidirectional communication between components with Cap’n Proto-style semantics and ocap-aligned design

  • 2024-04: Why Workers environment variables contain live objects

  • 2022-09: Introducing workerd: the Open Source Workers runtime

  • 2021-10: Dynamic Process Isolation: Research by Cloudflare and TU Graz

  • 2021-08: Durable Objects: Easy, Fast, Correct — Choose three

  • 2020-07: Mitigating Spectre and Other Security Threats: The Cloudflare Workers Security Model
entry.content:
• 2024-04: We’ve added JavaScript-native RPC to Cloudflare Workers – Kenton Varda introduces a secure, ergonomic RPC mechanism built into the Workers platform, enabling structured, streamed, bidirectional communication between components with Cap’n Proto-style semantics and ocap-aligned design

  • 2024-04: Why Workers environment variables contain live objects

  • 2022-09: Introducing workerd: the Open Source Workers runtime

entry.title: Why Workers environment variables contain live objects
Spritely Goblins v0.13.0: Object Persistence and Easier IO
entry.summary: "introduces the Aurie persistence system for long-lived objects, simplifies actor definition with define-actor, and adds the ^io actor for asynchronous IO"
entry.content: "introduces the Aurie persistence system for long-lived objects, simplifies actor definition with define-actor, and adds the ^io actor for asynchronous IO"

entry.title: Fuchsia OS powers all Nest Hub devices
entry.summary: – Fuchsia’s capability-based component framework is now deployed across all Nest Hub models, replacing the legacy Cast OS; each system component runs with only the capabilities it is explicitly granted, demonstrating ocap principles at scale in a mainstream consumer product
entry.content: – Fuchsia’s capability-based component framework is now deployed across all Nest Hub models, replacing the legacy Cast OS; each system component runs with only the capabilities it is explicitly granted, demonstrating ocap principles at scale in a mainstream consumer product

entry.title: Sandstorm
entry.summary:
is a self-hosted web productivity suite and App Market with WordPress, Rocket.Chat, IPython Notebook and many more. Sandstorm's Capability-based Security protects you and your data against application bugs.
  • 2024-01: Sandstorm now belongs to Sandstorm.org
  • 2023-10: Sandstorm, Tempest, and the Future
  • 2020-02-22: Announcing the release of vagrant-spk 1.0
  • 2017-03-02: connecting to external HTTP APIs via the Powerbox and related powerbox enhancements
    v0.200 (2017-01-28), v0.203
  • 2015-02-06: One click to try an open source web application
entry.content:
is a self-hosted web productivity suite and App Market with WordPress, Rocket.Chat, IPython Notebook and many more. Sandstorm's Capability-based Security protects you and your data against application bugs.
  • 2024-01: Sandstorm now belongs to Sandstorm.org

entry.title: seL4
entry.summary: is the world's first operating-system kernel with an end-to-end proof of implementation correctness and security enforcement; it is available as open source.
entry.content: is the world's first operating-system kernel with an end-to-end proof of implementation correctness and security enforcement; it is available as open source.

entry.title: Announcing KataOS and Sparrow | Google Open Source Blog
entry.summary: “As the foundation for this new operating system, we chose seL4 as the microkernel because it puts security front and center; it is mathematically proven secure, with guaranteed confidentiality, integrity, and availability.”
entry.content: “As the foundation for this new operating system, we chose seL4 as the microkernel because it puts security front and center; it is mathematically proven secure, with guaranteed confidentiality, integrity, and availability.”

entry.title: Hardened JavaScript
entry.summary:
"Hardened JavaScript is a standards track mode for the JavaScript language for safe plugin systems and supply chain attack resistance. Hardening JavaScript improves a program’s integrity in the face of adversarial code in the same process."
  • 2024-10 SES 1.9.0 introduces immutable ArrayBuffers
  • 2023-09 Decentralizing the wallet experience with MetaMask Snaps
  • 2021-09: SES-0.14.3 6190052
  • 2020-03: SES-0.7.6 9385d44
  • 2019-12: Making 'npm install' Safe - QCon New York "Kate Sills on security issues using NPM packages, the EventStream incident, and SES" as possible solutions to npm supply-chain risks.
  • 2019-06: Higher-order Smart Contracts across Chains Agoric + Protocol Labs // - Mark Miller
  • 2018-10-15: SF Cryptocurrency Devs: Agoric - Programming Secure Smart Contracts
  • 2018-07-28: Agoric Releases SES: Secure JavaScript f4d3d5a
entry.content:
"Hardened JavaScript is a standards track mode for the JavaScript language for safe plugin systems and supply chain attack resistance. Hardening JavaScript improves a program’s integrity in the face of adversarial code in the same process."
  • 2024-10 SES 1.9.0 introduces immutable ArrayBuffers
  • 2023-09 Decentralizing the wallet experience with MetaMask Snaps
  • 2021-09: SES-0.14.3 6190052
  • 2020-03: SES-0.7.6 9385d44
  • 2019-12: Making 'npm install' Safe - QCon New York "Kate Sills on security issues using NPM packages, the EventStream incident, and SES" as possible solutions to npm supply-chain risks.
  • 2019-06: Higher-order Smart Contracts across Chains Agoric + Protocol Labs // - Mark Miller
  • 2018-10-15: SF Cryptocurrency Devs: Agoric - Programming Secure Smart Contracts
  • 2018-07-28: Agoric Releases SES: Secure JavaScript f4d3d5a

entry.title: Newspeak
entry.summary: is an object-capability programming platform that lets you develop code in your web browser. Like Self, Newspeak is message-based; all names are dynamically bound. However, like Smalltalk, Newspeak uses classes rather than prototypes. The current version of Newspeak runs on top of WASM.
entry.content: is an object-capability programming platform that lets you develop code in your web browser. Like Self, Newspeak is message-based; all names are dynamically bound. However, like Smalltalk, Newspeak uses classes rather than prototypes. The current version of Newspeak runs on top of WASM.

entry.title: Cap’n Proto
entry.summary:
is a high performance serialization and RPC protocol with distributed and persistent capabilities and promise pipelining. Bindings to python, JavaScript (in node.js), Go, Rust, etc. are available
  • 2020-04-23: Cap'n Proto: Cap'n Proto 0.8: Streaming flow control, HTTP-over-RPC, fibers, etc.
  • 2014-12-15: Cap'n Proto 0.5, and how it is central to Sandstorm by Kenton Varda
entry.content:
is a high performance serialization and RPC protocol with distributed and persistent capabilities and promise pipelining. Bindings to python, JavaScript (in node.js), Go, Rust, etc. are available

entry.title: On-target package installation and deployment
entry.summary: – introduces a package management model where untrusted tools like curl, libarchive, and GnuPG are used within tightly confined compartments; a ~1000-line download manager orchestrates deployment without expanding the TCB

entry.title: Monte
entry.summary: is a nascent dynamic programming language reminiscent of Python and E. It is based upon The Principle of Least Authority (POLA), which governs interactions between objects, and a capability-based object model, which grants certain essential safety guarantees to all objects.
entry.content: is a nascent dynamic programming language reminiscent of Python and E. It is based upon The Principle of Least Authority (POLA), which governs interactions between objects, and a capability-based object model, which grants certain essential safety guarantees to all objects.
